author: Europa Press
title: Robles felicita a los jóvenes que se van a convertir en soldados profesionales por "elegir esta opción vital"
text:
SAN FERNANDO (CÁDIZ), 19 Ene. (EUROPA PRESS) -
Los aspirantes a soldados profesionales del Centro de Formación de Tropa (Cefot) número 2 de San Fernando (Cádiz), en el Acuartelamiento 'Camposoto', han recibido este viernes la visita de la ministra de Defensa, Margarita Robles, y del jefe de Estado Mayor del Ejército de Tierra (JEME), general de Ejército Amador Enseñat. Robles los ha felicitado por "elegir esta opción vital que es un motivo de orgullo".
Según ha indicado en una nota el Ministerio, alrededor de 1.100 alumnos del segundo ciclo de 2023 están recibiendo formación en este centro de enseñanza del Ejército de Tierra y, el próximo sábado 27 de enero, tras la jura de bandera, se convertirán en soldados profesionales.
"Una elección de la que se tienen que sentir muy orgullosos", les ha asegurado la ministra, que ha añadido que "primero porque es una vocación de servicio, servir a España y a los demás, y segundo porque es una profesión que te permite tener futuro profesional y formar parte de una gran familia".
Robles ha recordado que siempre, en situaciones de emergencia y difíciles, han estado y están las Fuerzas Armadas y, además "el Ejército español hoy en día es un ejército preparado que siempre se pone como ejemplo de formación en las misiones internacionales".
El coronel jefe del Cefot-2, Pablo Delgado, ha explicado las actividades formativas del centro y las reformas que se han llevado a cabo en los últimos años para atender el progresivo incremento de aspirantes que llegan allí.
En ese sentido, la ministra Robles ha dicho que "en este momento el Ministerio de Defensa tiene un buen presupuesto para poner instalaciones al día", remarcando que "la prioridad son los hombres y mujeres de las Fuerzas Armadas, porque se lo merecen todo".
El coronel Delgado se mostrado satisfecho con la labor de su equipo de docentes y profesores, señalando que "el objetivo es que se vayan de aquí orgullosos con la profesión que han elegido, y creo que se consigue en un 90 por ciento", añadiendo que "es muy gratificante el ver cómo van creciendo y ganando confianza en sí mismos y convertirse en una piña entre ellos".
Los alumnos del Cefot se someten durante cinco meses a un programa de estudios, con jornadas de instrucción y maniobras, dividido en tres etapas: orientación y adaptación, formación general militar y formación específica.
Además, el Cefot-2 imparte también durante dos semanas la formación a los reservistas voluntarios en sus tres categorías de oficial, suboficial y tropa, una experiencia inolvidable para militares y civiles. "Es digno de vivirlo. Civiles de mi edad, incluso han llegado a venir matrimonios, que vienen como niños ilusionados a dar lo mejor de su experiencia profesional", ha señalado el coronel.
Por su parte, el JEME ha felicitado a los profesores por su esfuerzo de enseñanza y a los aspirantes que la semana próxima se convertirán en soldados profesionales, a los que ha recordado que tengan "siempre presente que es un compromiso con España y los españoles", al mismo tiempo que ha subrayado que "la carrera militar es una carrera llena también de oportunidades".
ARTILLERÍA DE CAMPAÑA Posteriormente, la ministra Robles se ha trasladado al Regimiento de Artillería de Costa Racta Número 4, ubicado también en el Acuartelamiento 'Camposoto', y que tiene entre sus principales misiones el control y defensa de las costas, en particular el Estrecho de Gibraltar.
El coronel jefe Luis Gutiérrez de León ha guiado el recorrido por la unidad y por la exposición estática de material, con piezas de artillería y sensores cuya función ha sido explicada con detalle a la ministra.
Al Racta Número 4 pertenecía la sargento Débora Grau, fallecida en un accidente durante unas maniobras en el 2021. La titular de Defensa ha depositado una ofrenda floral en el monolito erigido en su recuerdo dentro del acuartelamiento.
Dependiente del Mando de Artillería de Campaña encuadrado en la Fuerza Terrestre, esta unidad despliega cuatro veces al año; dos en el área de Gibraltar y otras dos en puertos o lugares de interés para la defensa del litoral español, como por ejemplo Menorca, según ha señalado el Ministerio, que ha indicado que también interviene en misiones en el exterior y actualmente se preparan algunos efectivos para operar una batería en la misión la eFP de Letonia. Asimismo, el regimiento materializa multitud de colaboraciones con la Armada, tanto en sus ejercicios principales como en otros.
El Racta Número 4 se creó en 1710 con la denominación de 'Primer Batallón del Regimiento de Real Artillería de España' y guarnición en Valencia, y es, por tanto, el regimiento más antiguo de la península. Desde hace más de 150 años tiene su plaza en Cádiz.
Más información Fuerzas Armadas Margarita Robles

author: VideoElephant
title: Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024
text: At the start of the new year, 22 states and 43 cities and counties are increasing the hourly minimum wage, benefiting nearly 10 million people. author: Elena Luchian
title: Man Buys a 1989 Ferrari Testarossa for Cheap, Finds a Gazillion Problems - autoevolution
text: This guy never learns his lessons. He had a cheap Testarossa before. After that stint, he swore he would never do it again. But that was six years ago when he bought the cheapest Testarossa in the US with the insurance money that he got after another of his cars burned down to the ground. Back then, Tyler Hoove, because he is the one we are dealing with, paid $85,000 for the car, but a month later, due to some title issues, the selling dealer had to buy it back. The A five-speed manual transmission gearbox put the power down through the rear wheels. Those were enough for an acceleration from 0 to 62 mph (0 to 100 kph) in 5.8 seconds and a top speed of 180 mph (290 kph). Back then, the Testarossa hit the market ready to battle the The model was a magnet for VIPs. Celebrities such as It was its popularity that kept it in production from 1984 until 1991. During that time, 9,939 examples rolled off the production line in Maranello, Italy. The figures made it one of the most mass-produced Ferraris of all time. Right now, a 40-year-old It is a 1989 model year, which is far from being a low-mileage example since it was used as a daily driver by the previous owner. The odometer reads 42,000 miles (67,592 kilometers). That is one of the factors that surely affected the final price. Its collectability is already ruined, so Tyler won't have to worry about that. Tyler notes that it looks perfect from 15 or 20 feet back. It has never been in a serious accident, there is no salvage title attached to it. There are issues on board the car as well. The leather covering the dashboard has started to shrink. The material on the top of the instrument cluster has been stapled so it would not start running forward. So, Tyler will also need to reupholster that area. The tires on this Ferrari should probably be about 20 or 30 years old, so the car really needs new ones. The car sat for years before being purchased. It had its clutch replaced some 2,000 or 3,000 miles ago, in 2013. The previous owner made sure the engine ran, so he paid $18,000 to get it running again. The front brakes were also redone. The Ferrari still rocks its stock exhaust, but Tyler is considering replacing it with something that can bring more sound drama. There is an aftermarket reverse camera on the engine lid, which might come in handy, considering the not-so-great visibility the grand tourer offers. There is the sophisticated and somehow pointless seat belt system on board. The old Panasonic radio still works, but the AC doesn't. Meanwhile, the center console is covered in buttons and switches, something that you don't see in cars of today anymore. Hoover takes the car to David Long aka Car Wizard of Omega Auto Clinic to take a look at it. He is the one who has recently purchased a What worries the Car Wizard the most is the corrosion that is eating up the frame and floor. That is also one of the main reasons the Ferrari was so cheap. Tyler will have to ask for help from a restoration shop to fix his Testarossa. The good news is that the car will not split in two. The Wizard also notices some leaks. He can fix those, but not the corrosion part. The [Ferrari Testarossa](https://www.autoevolution.com/cars/ferrari-testarossa-1984.html#aeng_ferrari-testarossa-1984-49-b12)shot to fame in a heartbeat back in 1984, when it was unveiled at the Paris Motor Show as the successor of the Berlinetta Boxer. The rear-mid-engined model was powered by Ferrari's 4.9-liter Tipo F112 flat-12 engine, which pumped out 385 horsepower (390 metric horsepower) and 333 pound-feet (451 Newton meters) of torque. A five-speed manual transmission gearbox put the power down through the rear wheels. Those were enough for an acceleration from 0 to 62 mph (0 to 100 kph) in 5.8 seconds and a top speed of 180 mph (290 kph). Back then, the Testarossa hit the market ready to battle the [Lamborghini Countach](https://www.autoevolution.com/cars/lamborghini-countach-lp-400-1973.html#aeng_lamborghini-countach-lp-400-1973-39-v12), which already had a lead of a decade. The new owner of the 1989 Testarossa, Tyler, also owns a Countach. The model was a magnet for VIPs. Celebrities such as [Michael Jordan](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/michael-jordan-once-gave-scottie-pippen-his-own-ferrari-for-christmas-199518.html), Mike Tyson, Elton John, and Alain Delon just had to have one. Besides, Enzo Ferrari knew exactly how to advertise the model. He gifted Don Johnson, the star of the Miami Vice series, a brand-new silver 1989 Testarossa. Executive producer Michael Mann also had one, but his sports car was painted in blue metallic, while a white one featured in the series. It was its popularity that kept it in production from 1984 until 1991. During that time, 9,939 examples rolled off the production line in Maranello, Italy. The figures made it one of the most mass-produced Ferraris of all time. Right now, a 40-year-old [Testarossa](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/a-short-history-of-one-of-the-most-popular-ferraris-of-all-time-the-testarossa-152616.html)would hit the used car market for an average price of around $148,000. However, Tyler Hoover of Hoovies Garage brags about buying a super cheap Testarossa. He paid $70,000 for the car. But is it really worth it? It is a 1989 model year, which is far from being a low-mileage example since it was used as a daily driver by the previous owner. The odometer reads 42,000 miles (67,592 kilometers). That is one of the factors that surely affected the final price. Its collectability is already ruined, so Tyler won't have to worry about that. Tyler notes that it looks perfect from 15 or 20 feet back. It has never been in a serious accident, there is no salvage title attached to it. The model still seems to have the original paint, which displays chips and dents on the front end, fenders, doors, and just about everywhere else. There are issues on board the car as well. The leather covering the dashboard has started to shrink. The material on the top of the instrument cluster has been stapled so it would not start running forward. So, Tyler will also need to reupholster that area. The tires on this Ferrari should probably be about 20 or 30 years old, so the car really needs new ones. The car sat for years before being purchased. It had its clutch replaced some 2,000 or 3,000 miles ago, in 2013. The previous owner made sure the engine ran, so he paid $18,000 to get it running again. The front brakes were also redone. The Ferrari still rocks its stock exhaust, but Tyler is considering replacing it with something that can bring more sound drama. There is an aftermarket reverse camera on the engine lid, which might come in handy, considering the not-so-great visibility the grand tourer offers. There is the sophisticated and somehow pointless seat belt system on board. The old Panasonic radio still works, but the AC doesn't. Meanwhile, the center console is covered in buttons and switches, something that you don't see in cars of today anymore. The park lights are in that center console, the pop-up headlights controls are on the left, and the fog lights are up in the headliner panel. There is also a button that opens the glove box compartment door, which contains a huge mirror. Hoover takes the car to David Long aka Car Wizard of Omega Auto Clinic to take a look at it. He is the one who has recently purchased a [superb 1963 Cadillac Coupe deVille](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/mechanic-buys-superb-1963-cadillac-coupe-deville-wife-says-it-s-ok-238917.html)from Missouri that his wife labeled as "ok" before she really showed enthusiasm. What worries the Car Wizard the most is the corrosion that is eating up the frame and floor. That is also one of the main reasons the Ferrari was so cheap. Tyler will have to ask for help from a restoration shop to fix his Testarossa. The good news is that the car will not split in two. The Wizard also notices some leaks. He can fix those, but not the corrosion part. If you liked the article, please follow us: [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/theautoevolution/)

author: Daniel Susco
title: Montgomery County deputy accused of taking cash, property from court building
text: A Montgomery County Sheriff’s deputy is facing charges after he was accused of taking money and some “small property” from temporary storage at the Dayton Municipal Court/Montgomery County Common Pleas Court building.Gerald Barnes, 48, was indicted Thursday by a Montgomery County grand jury on one count of theft in office, a fifth-degree felony, and one count of misdemeanor theft.Barnes has been an employee of the sheriff’s office since 1996 and a deputy since 2004.According to a release from the Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office, the charges reach back to an incident in March, when a deputy noticed a small amount of cash and other property missing from a temporary storage location near the entrance to the court building.The sheriff’s office said that the storage area houses items that are left behind at the weapons detection area, and normally those items would be placed into the property room for safe keeping.The deputy checked closed circuit video of the area and saw Barnes appeared to have taken the money and other property from temporary storage, the release said. A supervisor was notified, the Sheriff’s Office Special Investigations Unit was assigned to investigate, and Barnes was placed on administrative leave while charges were presented to a grand jury. An internal investigation will also end when the criminal case concludes, the sheriff’s office said, adding that Barnes is currently on unpaid leave and can’t act as a law enforcement officer.Montgomery County Sheriff Rob Streck said, “These allegations are obviously troubling and situations like this tarnish the trust of both citizens and fellow law enforcement officers.”A summons was issued for Barnes to be in the Montgomery County Common Pleas Court to be arraigned May 9.

organizations.name: dayton municipal court/montgomery county common pleas court building.gerald barnes
